com.coveros.selenified.utilities

Class Sauce

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coveros.selenified.utilities.Hub
      • com.coveros.selenified.utilities.Sauce

  • public class Sauce
extends Hub
    Utilities class to interact with sauce labs, retrieving information such as username, key, and test status
    Version:
    3.2.1
    Author:
    Max Saperstone

    • Method Detail

      • isSauce

        public static Boolean isSauce()
        Determine whether the hub parameter is set, and if it is, is it set to sauce labs? Iff, then will return true, otherwise, returns false
        Returns:
        Boolean: whether sauce labs is specified as the hub

      • setupSauceCapabilities

        public static void setupSauceCapabilities(org.openqa.selenium.remote.DesiredCapabilities desiredCapabilities)
        Sauce labs has specific capabilities to manage the selenium version used. The version is obtained from the POM (or could be passed in via CMD to override) and then set so that Sauce sets the specific selenium version, instead of their default: https://wiki.saucelabs.com/display/DOCS/Test+Configuration+Options#TestConfigurationOptions-SeleniumVersion Additionally, the iedriverVersion is set to match the selenium version as suggested, if ie is the chosen browser Finally, the default platform for edge is set to windows 10

      • getSauceConnection

        public com.saucelabs.saucerest.SauceREST getSauceConnection()
                                                     throws MalformedURLException
        Creates a new connection to sauce labs
        Returns:
        SauceREST: an object with information to connect to/update sauce labs
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - if no sauce connection is set, invalid hub will be thrown
